title: Executive Order creates 'Schedule G' for non-career policy-making/advocating positions
summary:
On July 17, 2025, the White House issued an executive order creating
'Schedule G' in the excepted service for noncareer policy-making or
policy-advocating positions. OPM guidance states these appointees require
White House review and generally depart with the appointing President.
Supporters call it a fix for a 'gap' in hiring authorities; critics warn it
erodes merit protections and expands political hiring.
